## Applying for a Visa to Travel to the United States

After being accepted to an [SEVP-certified school](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/school-search) and getting a receipt for payment of the [I-901 fee,](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/students/paying-i-901-sevis-fee) you [can apply for a visa](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/frequently-asked-questions) at a U.S. embassy or consulate.

Learn how to apply for your visa. Review the [student visas page](https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/us-visas/study.html "(opens in a new window)") on [travel.state.gov,](http://travel.state.gov/ "(opens in a new window)") as well as the instructions at the website of the [embassy or consulate](http://www.usembassy.gov/ "(opens in a new window)") where you will apply for a visa.  After you receive your visa, check to see that you received the right type of visa and that your name and date of birth are correct and  match the information in your passport.

Related Tags: [Student Visa](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/filter?filter=78)
